summary: The Departments of the Interior and the Treasury awarded $32.7 billion to tribal entities for COVID-19 relief. Nonfederal entities that spend at least $750,000 in federal funds in a year are required to get a "single audit"—an independent review of their financial statements and federal awards. Some tribal entities met this condition for the first time. Interior and Treasury should ensure tribal entities get the...
title: Single Audits: Interior and Treasury Need to Improve Their Oversight of COVID-19 Relief Funds Provided to Tribal Entities
